column4: Hi guys, having an issue with slow i/o disk speeds. 3d effects (compiz) are lightning quick and as long as an request doesn't involve disk access it's normal. Decompression and removing and installing software is abysmally slow.
Like pre 486 slow.
check your disk with palimset, or some other utility.
What is the synatx you suggest to check the disk?
go to system/administration/disk utility and browse around in there - check your drives there first.
Do you know the terminal command? I use xubuntu.
you can use fsck, but you'll have to restart to do that I believe.
What is the binary name?
Of the application you recommend I check out...
I'll dig that up, ... fsck - FileSystemChecKer
I know what fsck is, but I just need the first app you recommended. I think If I knew how to fully operate fsck I probably wouldn't be here ;-)
check out that last post here: http://www.overclock.net/linux-unix/588130-ubuntu-9-10-failing-hard-disk.html
what do you mean by extraction?
Extraction of an array of rar files for example.
sonds like a disk IO buffer issue to me.
Yes, the extraction begins very quickly then practically stops. That sounds right to me...
do you have another drive handy?
I have four...
In the system now?
are you using the motherboard RAID system?
The disk is about a year old, roughly.
No.
there it is!
the e0 is a dead give away
